title: How to Find Rare Pokémon

methods.name: Finding Rare Pokémon on Pokémon Go

steps.headline: Level yourself up.
steps.description: Your chances of finding rare Pokémon goes up the higher your trainer level is. You can level up by battling, collecting, walking around, and using Lucky Eggs.

steps.headline: Use the Buddy System.
steps.description: The Buddy System in Pokémon Go allows you to select a Pokémon from your collection as a traveling companion. This allows you to earn candies for your Pokémon buddy by walking around, which you can use to evolve your Pokémon. The distance you need to walk varies depending on the Pokémon you choose. Use the following steps to select a Pokémon buddy:Tap your trainer's face in the lower-left corner. Tap the icon with three lines (☰) in the upper-right corner. Tap Buddy. Select a Pokémon

steps.headline: Hatch rare Pokémon from eggs.
steps.description: You can find eggs at PokéStops all over. Place an egg in an incubator and walk around to hatch the egg. You get an unlimited use Incubator early on in the game. You can also get limited-use incubators. Put an egg in an incubator and walk to hatch the egg. Most of the rare Pokémon are found in the 5 KM eggs, with the rarest found in the 10 KM eggs.

steps.headline: Keep an eye on the Pokémon tab.
steps.description: Tap the icon in the lower-right corner to see what Pokémon are nearby in the area. Pokémon you haven't captured appear as silhouettes. When you see a silhouette, tap it and locate the Pokémon. It might be a rare Pokémon.

steps.headline: Check out new areas.
steps.description: Pokémon tend to appear in certain areas depending on their type. Check out new areas to find Pokémon you haven't found. Just remember that rare Pokémon don't spawn as frequently as regular Pokémon. Just because you didn't find one in a location you've visited doesn't mean it won't appear later on. Weather also affects the type of Pokémon you are likely to find.

steps.headline: Participate in Raid battles.
steps.description: Legendary Pokémon can be found by participating in Raid battles. In Raid battles, multiple players team up to defeat a legendary Pokémon. If successful, each player has a chance to catch a super-rare Pokémon of their own. To participate in a Raid battle, look for a gym that has an egg over it. Head over to the area where the gym is located to participate in the Raid battle. Legendary Pokémon are only available for a limited time.

steps.headline: Travel to find new Pokémon.
steps.description: Some Pokémon are exclusive to certain regions and countries. While it may not be practical to travel the globe looking for rare Pokémon, if you happen to be traveling, take your Pokémon Go game with you. The further you travel, the more likely you are to find new and rare Pokémon.

methods.name: Finding Rare Pokémon on Pokémon: Sword and Shield

steps.headline: Get Fly, Cut, Rock Smash, and other HMs.
steps.description: These are special HMs you get from catching different Pokémon types. These will help you get to areas of the map you couldn't get to at the start of the game.

steps.headline: Learn Paralyze, Hypnosis, Confusion.
steps.description: You can learn these TMs by training your Pokémon. You might try Poison, Mean Look, and False Swipe as well. Level up a Pokémon with these TMs to level 30 - 39. False Swipe is a useful TM that leaves a Pokémon with 1 HP. This prevents you from accidentally knocking the Pokémon out. You can purchase from TM94 False Swipe from the Western Pokémon Center just before Route 3 in Motostoke for 10,000 Pokédollars. Talk to the NPC on the right who sells TMs.

steps.headline: Progress through little ways through the game.
steps.description: To increase your chances of finding a rare Pokémon, you should progress at least halfway through the game, if not more. This will help you level up and unlock more areas to find Pokémon.

steps.headline: Buy 12 to 20 Ultra Balls.
steps.description: These will increase your chances of catching a rare and tough Pokémon. You can purchase Ultra Balls at a Poké Mart.

steps.headline: Search for rare Pokémon in different areas.
steps.description:
Rare Pokémon tend to spawn in very specific areas. Go where you couldn't go when you started the game. (exp: Tunnel, Cave, etc.). Search all over the place. The following is a list of rare Pokémon and where you can find them:
Sizzlipede:  1% chance of spawning in the grass along Route 3. Pumpkaboo XL:   1% chance of spawning in the overworld along Route 4, Hammerlocke Hills, and Giant’s Mirror, depending on weather conditions. Eevee:  1% - 5% chance of being spawning the overworld along Route 4, depending on the version of the game. Applin:  10% chance of spawning in the grass along Route 5, Dusty Bowl, Giant's Mirror, and Stony Wilderness. Trapinch:  1% -  5% chance of being spawning the overworld along Route 6, depending on the version of the game. Falinks:  2% chance of being spawning the grass along Route 8, or 4% chance of spawning in the grass at Lake of Outrage during overcast weather. Pincurchin:  5% chance of spawning in the grass along Route 9. Dhelmise: 1% chance of spawning in Circhester Bay or Outer Spikemuth along Route 9. Duraludon: 1% chance of spawning in the overworld along Route 10, 2% chance of spawning in the overworld of Lake of Outrage during a thunderstorm. Stonjourner & Eiscube:  1% chance of spawning in the grass along Route 10, 5% chance of spawning in the grass at Lake of Outrage during a sandstorm. Sinistea:  10% chance of spawning a forgery, and 1% chance of spawning an authentic Sinistea in the grass of Glimwood Tangle

Cufant:  1% chance of spawning in the overworld of Bridge Field, 5% chance in overcast weather and intense sun, 10% chance during snowstorms. Dreepy:  1% chance of spawning in the grass of Lake of Outrage during foggy, or overcast weather, or thunderstorms.

steps.headline: Battle the rare Pokémon.
steps.description: Once you find a rare Pokémon, you'll need to battle it. Be sure to use a high-level Pokémon. Use Paralyze to put it to sleep. You might want to use a TM that won't let Pokémon escape. For example, Mean Look.

steps.headline: Use the Ultra Ball to capture the Pokémon.
steps.description: Throw an Ultra Ball to capture it. If it doesn't work, damage the Pokémon until it has Red HP or Yellow HP, then try throwing the Ultra Ball again.

text:
Finding Rare Pokémon on Pokémon Go Level yourself up. Your chances of finding rare Pokémon goes up the higher your trainer level is. You can level up by battling, collecting, walking around, and using Lucky Eggs. Use the Buddy System. The Buddy System in Pokémon Go allows you to select a Pokémon from your collection as a traveling companion. This allows you to earn candies for your Pokémon buddy by walking around, which you can use to evolve your Pokémon. The distance you need to walk varies depending on the Pokémon you choose. Use the following steps to select a Pokémon buddy:Tap your trainer's face in the lower-left corner. Tap the icon with three lines (☰) in the upper-right corner. Tap Buddy. Select a Pokémon Hatch rare Pokémon from eggs. You can find eggs at PokéStops all over. Place an egg in an incubator and walk around to hatch the egg. You get an unlimited use Incubator early on in the game. You can also get limited-use incubators. Put an egg in an incubator and walk to hatch the egg. Most of the rare Pokémon are found in the 5 KM eggs, with the rarest found in the 10 KM eggs. Keep an eye on the Pokémon tab. Tap the icon in the lower-right corner to see what Pokémon are nearby in the area. Pokémon you haven't captured appear as silhouettes. When you see a silhouette, tap it and locate the Pokémon. It might be a rare Pokémon. Check out new areas. Pokémon tend to appear in certain areas depending on their type. Check out new areas to find Pokémon you haven't found. Just remember that rare Pokémon don't spawn as frequently as regular Pokémon. Just because you didn't find one in a location you've visited doesn't mean it won't appear later on. Weather also affects the type of Pokémon you are likely to find. Participate in Raid battles. Legendary Pokémon can be found by participating in Raid battles. In Raid battles, multiple players team up to defeat a legendary Pokémon. If successful, each player has a chance to catch a super-rare Pokémon of their own. To participate in a Raid battle, look for a gym that has an egg over it. Head over to the area where the gym is located to participate in the Raid battle. Legendary Pokémon are only available for a limited time. Travel to find new Pokémon. Some Pokémon are exclusive to certain regions and countries. While it may not be practical to travel the globe looking for rare Pokémon, if you happen to be traveling, take your Pokémon Go game with you. The further you travel, the more likely you are to find new and rare Pokémon. Finding Rare Pokémon on Pokémon: Sword and Shield Get Fly, Cut, Rock Smash, and other HMs. These are special HMs you get from catching different Pokémon types. These will help you get to areas of the map you couldn't get to at the start of the game. Learn Paralyze, Hypnosis, Confusion. You can learn these TMs by training your Pokémon. You might try Poison, Mean Look, and False Swipe as well. Level up a Pokémon with these TMs to level 30 - 39. False Swipe is a useful TM that leaves a Pokémon with 1 HP. This prevents you from accidentally knocking the Pokémon out. You can purchase from TM94 False Swipe from the Western Pokémon Center just before Route 3 in Motostoke for 10,000 Pokédollars. Talk to the NPC on the right who sells TMs. Progress through little ways through the game. To increase your chances of finding a rare Pokémon, you should progress at least halfway through the game, if not more. This will help you level up and unlock more areas to find Pokémon. Buy 12 to 20 Ultra Balls. These will increase your chances of catching a rare and tough Pokémon. You can purchase Ultra Balls at a Poké Mart. Search for rare Pokémon in different areas. Rare Pokémon tend to spawn in very specific areas. Go where you couldn't go when you started the game. (exp: Tunnel, Cave, etc.). Search all over the place. The following is a list of rare Pokémon and where you can find them:
Sizzlipede:  1% chance of spawning in the grass along Route 3. Pumpkaboo XL:   1% chance of spawning in the overworld along Route 4, Hammerlocke Hills, and Giant’s Mirror, depending on weather conditions. Eevee:  1% - 5% chance of being spawning the overworld along Route 4, depending on the version of the game. Applin:  10% chance of spawning in the grass along Route 5, Dusty Bowl, Giant's Mirror, and Stony Wilderness. Trapinch:  1% -  5% chance of being spawning the overworld along Route 6, depending on the version of the game. Falinks:  2% chance of being spawning the grass along Route 8, or 4% chance of spawning in the grass at Lake of Outrage during overcast weather. Pincurchin:  5% chance of spawning in the grass along Route 9. Dhelmise: 1% chance of spawning in Circhester Bay or Outer Spikemuth along Route 9. Duraludon: 1% chance of spawning in the overworld along Route 10, 2% chance of spawning in the overworld of Lake of Outrage during a thunderstorm. Stonjourner & Eiscube:  1% chance of spawning in the grass along Route 10, 5% chance of spawning in the grass at Lake of Outrage during a sandstorm. Sinistea:  10% chance of spawning a forgery, and 1% chance of spawning an authentic Sinistea in the grass of Glimwood Tangle

Cufant:  1% chance of spawning in the overworld of Bridge Field, 5% chance in overcast weather and intense sun, 10% chance during snowstorms. Dreepy:  1% chance of spawning in the grass of Lake of Outrage during foggy, or overcast weather, or thunderstorms. Battle the rare Pokémon. Once you find a rare Pokémon, you'll need to battle it. Be sure to use a high-level Pokémon. Use Paralyze to put it to sleep. You might want to use a TM that won't let Pokémon escape. For example, Mean Look. Use the Ultra Ball to capture the Pokémon. Throw an Ultra Ball to capture it. If it doesn't work, damage the Pokémon until it has Red HP or Yellow HP, then try throwing the Ultra Ball again.
